Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

Description:
Data Engineer en Asturias.
Perfil buscado (Hombre/Mujer)

The Data Engineer will join the fast-growing analytics team and will have a high impact on a strategic digital transformation initiative with opportunities for career advancement as the team grows.

Analytics team uses the Azure Data Lake and Microsoft Power BI to provide analytics solutions and business data insights to a wide range of functions including sales supply chain operations and finance. As a specialist in our team you will be responsible for expanding this service and ensuring its continuing reliability and performance by leading initiatives to connect new data sources enhance existing data sources and manage intersections with external teams and processes.

Position activities include
Interface with enterprise architects to facilitate architecture security reviews for analytics applications
Provide administrative support for services related to analytics platforms including
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data Lake
Databricks
SQL Server
Ensure that applications have appropriate security models designed and applied
Maintain the Lakehouse architecture in ADLS using Databricks
Work with DevOps team to deploy solutions in production environments
Lead projects that include other team members and participate in projects led by other team members
Collaborate with team members across the world to share key learnings leverage ideas and solutions and to propagate best practices
Apply change management tools including training communication and documentation to manage upgrades changes and data migrations
Analyze and resolve issues and work with service providers to minimize the risk of recurrence

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment Data Engineer (Azure Databricks-Azure Data factory)

The Data Engineer to be qualified for this role must possess the following
Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area
4-7 years of relevant IT experience (Data Analytics Data Engineering)
Strong communication skills in English language (both written and spoken)
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them
Ability to coordinate with various teams across different functions
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as guide other team members
Ability to be an effective team member with remote colleagues spread across the world
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience with Azure platform (incl. ADF and ADLS)
Extensive experience in data concepts and tools
Preference will be given to candidates with these skills
Delta lake and Lakehouse architecture
Pandas and PySpark
Exposure to DevOps workflows
SQL

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment

Interesting professional opportunity based in Asturias.

Hybrid model

Azure Data,Databricks,SQL Server

Description:
Field Service Engineer en Barcelona.
Perfil buscado (Hombre/Mujer)

The Field Service Engineer will have the following responsibilities
Install (mechanical cabling) configure and start-up (commissioning) equipment at customer site as per pre-defined specifications.
Maintain adjust and replace on site devices of existing customer systems.
Follow rigorously safety and security on site company procedures.
Escalate to upper technical level problems that cant be solved independently.
Issue timely and accurate service reports (including expenses report).
Extend or help building a respectful relationship with customer by always adopting an exemplary attitude.

Multinational company leader in automatic data capture and process automation Project with high impact in the company and visibility

The Field Service Engineer must meet the following requirements
Associate or Bachelor degree in a technical field such as electronics networking
Fluent in Spanish and English Intermediate level.
2/3 years of experience on Field Service Activities in automation or other similar market with Electrical and Electronical devices.
Electrical Schematics reading.
Troubleshooting and diagnostic experience of hardware and software
Remote PC diagnostic and remedy support.
Good understanding of computer networks.
PLC communications experience Device-net Profinet Profibus.
Experience working with auto ID products.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Software (MS Dynamics is a plus).
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to travel domestic and UE (mainly Spain) extensively (up to 85 of time)
Willing to work during alternative work schedules such as weekend and/or overnight.

Multinational company leader in the automatic data capture and process automation markets specialised in the designing and production of bar code readers mobile computers sensors for detection measurement and safety RFID vision and laser marking systems is looking for a Field Service Engineer located in Barcelona.

Description:
We are EA
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform.
We are hiring a Data Engineering Intern for our Localization Data & AI team. Loc Data & AI ́s mission is to support and foster the use of data from all perspectives, along with the development of policies and procedures for the monitoring and active management of data in EA Localization. And our means include building data engineering products and solutions, such as integrating data from various sources such as APIs, databases, and file systems.
This includes an understanding of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) techniques.







We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

Description:
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.
The Role
Veeva Link seeks a mid to senior Python Data Engineer that will participate in all aspects of architecting and developing new and innovative data pipelines and data handling. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and new product development in an established company that is rapidly growing. This is a great opportunity for an engineer looking to expand their well-established career, who is excited about search, solving complex problems, ownership, and who enjoys working with technologies like Python, ElasticSearch, and AWS.

Description:
More recently, we have acquired the green energy start up Umeme in order to bring the green energy revolution to the Spanish market. Read more HERE.

It's in making this vision a reality that we are looking for you to help us achieve this.

At Octopus we’ve developed a data platform that provides data services to the business in the UK and our retail energy businesses around the world. The platform enables self-service of data analytics to hundreds of data hungry users as well as automation of all our data workflows from simple ETL jobs to ML training and prediction.

The data platform team works across the whole customer domain on anything from natural language understanding of our customer communications to processing billions of smart meter readings to build customised smart energy tariffs.

As the volume, scope and geographical range of our data services rapidly expand, we’re looking for an experienced data engineer to join the team to help us build and maintain our platform, pipelines and data sources.

Description:
Data Engineer and Analytics
JOB CONTEXT
Sanofi is globally deploying its new core model ERP covering Finance, SBS, Supply Chain, Trade, Manufacturing, Quality, Plant maintenance, warehouse management across all GBUs - through the implementation of a Global ERP (iSHIFT project) using SAP S4/HANA technology. All this together with other Core Solutions like QMS, LIMS and MES require strong data foundations to boost the integration between those solutions and provide a data platform to sustain the built of Digital Products.
JOB OVERVIEW
Within the Digital Analytics CoE team, Junior Data/Software Engineer will design and build solutions across different project to provide data for analytics / BI needs of different IA and Finance Ops products.
JOB SUMMARY
You will be part of a multidisciplinary team that works on the end-to-end needs of the analytics chain for Industrial Affairs & Finance Ops of the Sanofi group. You will deploy a data engineering pipeline and integration solutions with technically robust lifecycle management (e.g. new releases, change management, monitoring and troubleshooting) to provide this team with reliable datasets / KPIs.

Description:
We are offering a Data Analyst position to build the global contextual advertising leader.

WHO WE ARE
Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.
We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.

Puesto
Data Engineer
Referencia
Data Engineer
Plazas vacantes
1
Jornada
De Lunes a Viernes horario flexible, posible teletrabajo

ShopFully is the tech company reinventing local shopping worldwide.

Thanks to our marketplaces we enable 45+ million users globally to save money and time when shopping at their favourite local stores. Our AI-driven platform helps 400+ retailers and top brands reach their ideal audiences and finally drive them to their stores, boosting local sales. This is why today we are one of the leading international players in Drive to Store.

We’re a team of over 370, spanning 30 different nationalities across 12 countries. Are you ready to join us?

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL

You will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable ETL processes towards the enterprise data warehouse and data lake
You will take care of everything related to the use of data to support the sale and improvement of our products (e.g. search for products loopholes), from the data ingestion phase to the visualization phase
your relational skills will be an advantage in the analysis and definition of data processes that meet business requirements
Our data platform is completely in the AWS cloud, it is modern and inspired by the big technological players and allows us to manage both batch and real-time applications.

SKILLS WE’RE SEARCHING FOR

You have a good knowledge of the SQL language and Python
You have knowledge of the basics of Big Data application development
You have knowledge of the cloud world and in particular AWS
You are able to work in a team and coordinate with multiple internal stakeholders

OTHER ABILITIES THAT WILL WIN OUR HEART

You have knowledge of the basics of the dimensional fact model and data warehousing
You have knowledge of at least one ETL tool (Pentaho Data Integration, Talend, etc.)
PySpark
It should be a plus also if you have knowledge of Tableau and R

THIS IS WHAT YOU’LL FIND IF YOU START THE ADVENTURE WITH US

Zero degrees of separation.
We are very informal, love direct feedback and work by project, so you’ll get a chance to meet everyone. Our CEO, CTO and C-anything will be your colleagues in some activities and you’ll get to work with all of us!

Massive impact.
You’ll work on tech & products that will be used by hundreds of retailers and brands and millions of people (from your friends, to your neighbours, and maybe even your mother!).

Problems that you’ll love to solve.
Here, you’ll discover that every challenge is an opportunity to thrive and make an impact.

The best team you’ve ever met.
We’re young and talented, without being divas, and we are supportive of each other. We share knowledge and are each other’s number one fans.

Learning and growing.
What do you think about 70 hours Learning Time a year and the possibility of getting tech certifications like AWS? But most importantly, at ShopFully you’ll be learning by doing and making mistakes, which will allow you to improve day after day.

Smart working, but even smarter.
each team can choose the ShopFully Hub that suits them better. Rome, Sidney or Barcelona? You’ll be spoilt for choice!

Fun, fun, fun!
It can be a happy hour, a volleyball match, a tandem ride, a Halloween party. You name it!

Lunches on us.
We give meal vouchers, also while working remotely. It’s a little thing, but we want to take care of it.

Description:
Job Information
Industry
Retail
Work Experience
1-3 years
Salary
Máximo 38.000 euros bruto año.

¿Quieres desarrollar tu carrera profesional allí donde hacemos realidad las ideaciones de nuestros clientes mediante el uso de las tecnologías más disruptivas y avanzadas del mercado? ¿Te encanta afrontar nuevos retos tecnológicos y liderar la transformación digital de nuestros clientes? ¿Buscas un ecosistema con proyectos nacionales e internacionales?

En el equipo de Artificial Intelligence & Data del Delivery Center de Deloitte contamos con un grupo de profesionales que se enfrentan constantemente al reto de aplicar tecnologías especializadas de última generación ayudando a nuestros clientes en sus procesos de constante transformación digital. Nuestros profesionales en continua formación disponen de amplios conocimientos en tecnologías del ámbito Cloud, Inteligencia Artificial y el mundo del Dato. Nuestras metodologías de trabajo ágiles nos permiten, junto a avanzadas herramientas y los aceleradores de desarrollo más punteros del mercado, poner soluciones en manos de nuestros clientes en un tiempo récord.

Actualmente, precisamos incorporar un/a Data Engineer con PySpark para integrarse en nuestro equipo de Deloitte de manera indefinida.

¿Qué buscamos?

Experiencia profesional mínima 1 año en la transformación de datos a escala masiva basada tanto en servicios cloud como heramientas de integración de datos.
Python, Spark, PySpark.
Ingenierías o Grados en Ingeniería Informática, Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas o Estadística.
Nivel de inglés alto, mínimo B2
Orientación a resultados, capacidad analítica y espíritu de equipo.

¿Qué ofrecemos?

Formar parte de un equipo multicultural con los profesionales más cualificados, que te acompañarán y guiarán en tu día a día.
Trabajar en proyectos tecnológicamente punteros y altamente desafiantes para clientes líderes en sus sectores.
Disponer de un plan formativo a tu medida que te permita seguir desarrollándote tanto personal como profesionalmente con nosotros.
Contar con un seguimiento personalizado de tu carrera, con revisiones de rendimiento periódicas acompañadas de revisiones salariales.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico y flexible.
Disfrutar de 22 días de vacaciones además de 5 días en Navidad, 4 días en Semana Santa y jornada intensiva del 1 de Julio al 15 de septiembre.
Acceder a los numerosos beneficios sociales que ofrecemos, tales como seguro de vida y accidentes, subvención del seguro médico para ti y para tu familia, descuentos en gimnasios, ventajas fiscales en Ticket Restaurant, Guardería y Transporte y mucho más.
Generar impacto social y medioambiental, participando en las iniciativas organizadas por nuestra área de Responsabilidad Social Corporativa.
Participar en actividades y eventos extralaborales (Concursos, afterworks…) que fomentan un gran ambiente de trabajo y que consideramos nuestro mayor logro.

Estudios requeridos

Titulado universitario (en el ámbito de la ingeniería, telecomunicaciones, matemáticas, física...) o Ciclo de grado superior (en desarrollo de aplicaciones multiplataformas, desarrollo de aplicaciones web, ASIR o acorde)

Experiencia requerida

A partir de 2 años de experiencia (valorable a partir de 1 año)

Si quieres ver cómo tu trabajo tiene un impacto real en los clientes y personas, te gustan los retos tecnológicos y crees que nunca se deja de aprender… ¡Deloitte es tu sitio!

¿Aceptas el desafío?

Deloitte es una Firma de servicios profesionales firmemente comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades. En este sentido, la Firma aceptará y tramitará solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad, no discriminando por motivos de sexo, expresión de género, raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, enfermedad o condición de salud, predisposición genética a sufrir patologías, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación o identidad sexual, situación socioeconómica o cualquier otra condición o circunstancia personal o social.

Nuestro equipo de NATEEVO en Colombia crece y te estamos buscando .

NATEEVO, empresa de GrupoVASS, se construye desde el TALENTO, con equipos de buenos profesionales, a la vez que profesionales buenos, con mucha auto-exigencia, compañerismo, pasión y crecimiento continuo para aportar el máximo valor al negocio. No nos conformamos con lo que somos hoy y nuestro gen NATEEVO nos lleva a seguirnos desarrollando día a día, y a asumir retos cada vez más complejos y desafiantes en el ecosistema digital.

Desde la tecnología como piedra angular, y la estrategia digital como punta de lanza, trabajamos los proyectos con equipos multidisciplinares con expertise en todo el amplio abanico del ecosistema Digital; Analítica, User Experiece, SEO, SEM, Social Media, Marketing Automation, Gestión del cambio, Diseño, Brand…

Somos un equipo de más de 260 personas volcadas en ayudar a nuestros partners a ser mejores empresas, con la digitalización como punto de referencia.

¡Bienvenido a tu futuro !
Requisitos
En NATEEVO nos encontramos en la búsqueda de una persona encargado de entender el negocio y sus datos mediante la exploración, extracción, transformación y carga de los mismos contribuyendo de esta manera con el análisis para una
mejor toma de decisiones.



Desarrollar y dar mantenimiento a la solución de flujo de datos usando los servicios de Azure.
Extraer datos estructurados y no estructurados de un data warehouse
Construir tuberías de datos (data pipelines) robustas y escalables
Ejecutar las transformaciones necesarias para limpieza de datos
Cargar data transformada a sistemas de personalización y/o marketing
Automation para que la data sea aprovechada por el equipo operativo
Verificar la calidad y consistencia de los datos (input y output) comparando distintas fuentes.
Optimización de procesos, automatización y documentación de los mismos


PySpark, Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-Learn, Plotly o similares
Bases de datos SQL y NoSQL
Experiencia con Oracle SQL
RegEx
Git

¿Y ahora qué?

Si te ha llamado la atención, déjanos conocerte clicando en “solicitar una evaluación” . Si tu perfil tiene un buen encaje con todo lo que te hemos contado nos pondremos en contacto contigo a través de una breve llamada para conocerte mejor desde el equipo de Talent y después conocerás a alguien del equipo de tu futura área.

Description:
We’re a diverse group of committed individuals empowered to thrive on challenge, share ideas, and pursue our ambition to transform the way commerce works.

So what about you? Do you want to help shape the future? Join us and you’ll open the gateway to a world of endless possibilities.

At Productsup you’ll be an intrinsic player in a vibrant culture that brings together people with opportunities, ideas with implementation, and ambition with achievement.

You can make great things happen in your career by making great things happen in commerce.

Productsup - the place where people are empowered to shape the future of commerce.

Your role and goals

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d) to join our highly skilled and motivated Data Science team at Productsup.

Our team is currently working on state-of-the-art NLP and Machine Learning pipelines that differentiate Productsup from our competitors. You will have millions of product data specifications at your disposal, access to a strongly scalable inference and training infrastructure, and a team of highly talented data scientists and engineers.

In this role, you will help us in building multiple NLP and Machine Learning pipelines. You will become the sparring partner of our Lead Data Scientist and support the team in increasing the performance of our ML products.





Productsup values diversity. We celebrate our differences and strive to learn from each other with the firm conviction that diversity drives innovation. Our commitment to equal opportunities begins at the hiring process and extends to our whole working culture. We pledge to social and environmental initiatives that support a sustainable environment. Everyone has a unique contribution to make and all are welcome.

The team’s overarching goal is to develop a new generation of knowledge products, powered by technologies such as graph databases, ML/AI and cloud computing, aimed at extreme information users, both internally (e.g. in our newsrooms and Data Strategy teams) and externally. Kenmei Technologies is a Spanish company based in Valencia founded by telecoms and software experts focused on providing data intelligence with machine-based decisioning automating network operations and customer assurance to help operators to deal with the incoming increase of network complexity.
We are looking for a RF Engineer based in Spain.

What would you be doing?
Based within Kenmei Services Delivery Organization an experienced globally exposed organization you will be working on at the cutting edge of technology (4G 5G BigData ML/AI Network E2E operations) and will be involved with projects in diverse global locations.
In this role you will be part of an experienced network optimization team in charge of providing optimization activities in a multi-vendor and multi-technology environment for one of our main customers.

What do you need for that?
network rf, optimization tableau, call traces

Job_title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, 100% En remoto
Description:
Senior Business Intelligence Analyst en 100% En remoto.
Who we are
Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date our 200 000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science health humanities and social sciences engineering and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published evaluated and communicated to the world.

Key Responsibilities

Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team you will work regularly with teammates in other countries and with our community of researchers editors and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite in the office).

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team) an annual personal learning budget and dedicated L D time.

We offer free online yoga classes an employee assistance plan access to the Headspace app and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination including based on race national or ethnic origin age religion disability sex gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

SQL, Tableau, Agile, Kanban,

Description:
We’re a diverse group of committed individuals empowered to thrive on challenge, share ideas, and pursue our ambition to transform the way commerce works.

So what about you? Do you want to help shape the future? Join us and you’ll open the gateway to a world of endless possibilities.

At Productsup you’ll be an intrinsic player in a vibrant culture that brings together people with opportunities, ideas with implementation, and ambition with achievement.

You can make great things happen in your career by making great things happen in commerce.

Productsup - the place where people are empowered to shape the future of commerce.

Your role and goals

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d) to join our highly skilled and motivated Data Science team at Productsup.

Our team is currently working on state-of-the-art NLP and Machine Learning pipelines that differentiate Productsup from our competitors. You will have millions of product data specifications at your disposal, access to a strongly scalable inference and training infrastructure, and a team of highly talented data scientists and engineers.

In this role, you will help us in building multiple NLP and Machine Learning pipelines. You will become the sparring partner of our Lead Data Scientist and support the team in increasing the performance of our ML products.





Productsup values diversity. We celebrate our differences and strive to learn from each other with the firm conviction that diversity drives innovation. Our commitment to equal opportunities begins at the hiring process and extends to our whole working culture. We pledge to social and environmental initiatives that support a sustainable environment. Everyone has a unique contribution to make and all are welcome.

Job_title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, 100% En remoto
Description:
Senior Business Intelligence Analyst en 100% En remoto.
Who we are
Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date our 200 000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science health humanities and social sciences engineering and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published evaluated and communicated to the world.

Key Responsibilities

Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team you will work regularly with teammates in other countries and with our community of researchers editors and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite in the office).

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team) an annual personal learning budget and dedicated L D time.

We offer free online yoga classes an employee assistance plan access to the Headspace app and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination including based on race national or ethnic origin age religion disability sex gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Description:
Barcelona - Data Engineer - Full time
1.300€/mes
Última actualización: December 2, 2021
Sobre la posición
IOMED es una empresa especializada en la extracción y el procesamiento de datos médicos a través de herramientas de Inteligencia Artificial como Machine Learning y Procesamiento de Lenguaje Natural. Estructuramos la información clínica con el objetivo de acelerar la investigación clínica.
Tu función principal será trabajar en el análisis de datos de la industria médica aplicando mejoras en nuestros procesos, con el objetivo de asegurar la calidad del dato. Formarás parte de un equipo multidisciplinar con el que colaborarás diariamente en proyectos en el cual podrás aprender e impulsar nuevas ideas.

About DEXMA
Serving more than 4.000 organisations across +30 countries, DEXMA by Spacewell is a leading provider of Energy Management Software for commercial and industrial buildings. The DEXMA Platform is a cloud-based AI software that combines Big Data Analytics with Energy Efficiency to help thousands of facility managers, energy auditors and building owners around the world to detect, analyse and optimise energy consumption and costs, while becoming more sustainable. DEXMA was founded in 2007 in Barcelona, and is part of Spacewell that helps organizations across the globe to improve the performance of their building portfolios.
You'll be part of a growing, dynamic company. At DEXMA, we are full of contagious energy, hard work, and passion for what we do. We are fully committed to encouraging an environment where everyone is heard and feels a sense of belonging. We are proud to have a multicultural team that acknowledges a variety of backgrounds, skills and perspectives.

Description:
Summary
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, and Web Services at scale. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.
Canonical's Store team develops and operates the backend services that power the Snap Store and Charmhub.io marketplaces. Our services are built primarily in Python, within a bit of Golang. If you have a passion for clean APIs, have a bias towards shipping and believe that tests are the key to higher velocity and reliability, you'll fit right in.
We have some exciting challenges ahead including continuing to scale our production architecture, expand the store backend to handle additional package types, and enhance our on-prem offering for IoT and Enterprise solutions.

Description:
Overview:
Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker develops high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions that enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years and today, Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems, and a strong reputation among its customers. Worldwide, more than 7,500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations on all continents.

Acuity Spatial Genomics, Inc. is commercializing one of the most powerfully advantageous approaches in spatial biology. The Company brings together the premier spatial omics approach with leading-edge data acquisition and analysis capability. The pioneering in situ technology enables examination of some of the most important questions in genomics and gene expression at the single cell and sub-cellular level. We aim to find the best talent in the field to join and contribute to this extraordinary, exciting endeavor becoming a critical member of this groundbreaking opportunity.

Job_title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, 100% En remoto
Description:
Senior Business Intelligence Analyst en 100% En remoto.
Who we are
Frontiers is an award-winning open science platform and leading open access scholarly publisher.

We are one of the largest and most cited publishers globally. To date our 200 000 freely available research articles have received more than 1 billion views and downloads and 2 million citations. Our journals span science health humanities and social sciences engineering and sustainability. And we continue to expand into new academic disciplines so more researchers can publish open access.

Be part of the publishing revolution and help us transform the way research is published evaluated and communicated to the world.

Key Responsibilities

Benefits

With more than 50 nationalities represented in our global team you will work regularly with teammates in other countries and with our community of researchers editors and authors from around the globe.

Our mission to create solutions for healthy lives also extends to the working environment we provide for our employees.

This includes

Employees now have the flexibility to choose where they want to work with remote working available on a part- or full-time basis (not applicable to some Workplace/IT jobs due to nature of role requiring presence onsite in the office).

All employees have access to LinkedIn Learning (and Pluralsight for our technology team) an annual personal learning budget and dedicated L D time.

We offer free online yoga classes an employee assistance plan access to the Headspace app and four wellbeing days on top of your annual leave allowance.

Employees can dedicate three days each year to volunteer for a personal cause or through our volunteering partner platform Alaya.

Frontiers actively embraces diversity and is a safe and welcoming workplace. Recruitment is free from discrimination including based on race national or ethnic origin age religion disability sex gender identity or sexual orientation. With over 600 employees from more than 50 different nations our diversity creates vibrant teams and constantly challenges us to appreciate multiple perspectives.

Acerca de la posición
El equipo de Data Platform es responsable de ejecutar y mantener la infraestructura a cargo de administrar grandes volúmenes de datos en el entorno de la atención médica. Buscamos incorporar a este equipo un apasionado de las bases de datos que ayude al equipo a lograr una infraestructura que pueda escalar y crecer de forma segura y robusta para alcanzar todos los objetivos de negocio.
Colaborará con el resto de los equipos tech (especialmente con el equipo de DataOps y DevOps) analizando y comprendiendo las fuentes de datos, participando en el diseño y brindando información y orientación sobre la tecnología de bases de datos y las mejores prácticas de modelado de datos.

En Sopra Steria trabajamos para hacer posible la transformación digital de nuestros clientes y para conseguirlo necesitamos seguir creciendo y sumando gracias a personas como tú.

Nuestros empleados coinciden en el gran equipo y ambiente que formamos en Sopra Steria. Somos más de 46.000 personas trabajando en 25 países y nuestra misión es unir talento y tecnología, tratando de ayudarte a que encuentres un lugar en el que poder desarrollar todo tu potencial.

¿Te atreves a crear el futuro? ¿Buscas un reto profesional dónde crecer profesionalmente?
Ampliamos nuestro equipo con un perfil de Data Engineer.

Tus funciones serán:

Data Engineer en el entorno informacional de Seguros Generali con tecnologías cloud de Microsoft Azure:

Azure Databricks: para los desarrollos de código y funciones con Python y Pyspark, y la gestión de repositorios.
Azure DataWareHouse: reside la base del modelo DataVault del cual se extrae la info para las ETL's.
Azure DataLake: base de datos para almacenamiento de las tablas productivizadas finales, que luego son consumidas desde PowerBI.

Canonical is building a comprehensive automation suite to deliver a multi-cloud and on-premise data solution for the enterprise, which spans the full range of data stores and data technologies from big data, with Yugabyte, Spark and Kafka, through NoSQL and cache-layer capabilities like Redis, MongoDB and Opensearch, all the way to structured SQL engines like PostgreSQL and MySQL.
This is an exceptional opportunity for an experienced software engineer passionate about delivering high quality, reliable and automated infrastructure based on open source software running on Kubernetes, the public cloud and bare-metal. We are facing the challenge of fault-tolerant mission critical distributed systems and intend to deliver the world's best automation solution for delivering data platforms.
Experience using data platform tools is desirable, but not over hands-on experience installing, configuring and operating such technologies.

Si tienes habilidades y motivación en Data Engineering para machine learning, podrías ser la persona que estamos buscando para unirte a nuestro equipo. Con sede en Barcelona, serás responsable de diseñar, construir y mantener la infraestructura de datos de la empresa.
Desempeñarás un papel crítico en garantizar la precisión, confiabilidad y escalabilidad de nuestros sistemas de datos para el aprendizaje automático.

Tareas

Diseñar, construir y mantener pipelines de datos para el procesamiento de datos a gran escala y el aprendizaje automático.
Implementar soluciones de almacenamiento de datos, como data warehousing, data lakes y bases de datos.
Conocimientos deseados

Requisitos

Tecnologías IMPRESCINDIBLES

Beneficios

Perfil deseado

¿Quieres formar parte de una compañía especializada 100% en proyectos propios de #Data & #Analytics? Sí es así, ¡Sigue leyendo!

Aunque somos poco conocidos entre el gran público, en SDG trabajamos para la mitad de grupos del IBEX-35 y en multitud de empresas internacionales. Gracias al boom de la analítica, estamos en un ritmo constante de crecimiento y desde 1994 ayudamos a nuestros clientes a entender y analizar sus datos.

¿Cómo será tu día a día con nosotros?
Contar de 2 a 5 años de experiencia trabajando con herramientas de visualización, ETL (modelado del dato) y BBDD SQL ya que son la base de todos los proyectos en los que estarás involucrado.

At Data & Performance team of Schneider Electric, we are building Intel Data Store (IntelDS), a global Data Lake for enterprise data. It is a Big Data platform fully hosted on AWS and connected today to more than 40 data sources.

Connecting new sources to enrich the data scope of the platform.

Description:
As a Data Platform Engineer, you will support the design, implementation, and maintenance of our Data Platform. As one of the first team members, you will have a tangible impact on the final product.
The platform uses a mix of modern open-source technologies, such as Prefect, dbt, Spark, Iceberg, Redis Streams, etc., as well as our own Python connector library and various wrappers/automations. It supports both batch and streaming workloads.
You will join a team of driven engineers working together to deliver an amazing user experience and business value.
You will be responsible for:
Building the platform;

You will be responsible for implementing the applications that we use to upload and process bigger amounts of files and data from different sources. Your role is crucial for the success of our business as it is related to the security, reliability, availability and performance of our platform. We are applying to you as a collegial, fair, family-friendly employer. Join us and you have the opportunity to work with state of the art technology and methodology while contributing to develop the best software for the real estate market!
BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or a related subject.

Description:
**Please note: This is a 12-month, temporary contract and you will be payrolled through our 3rd party agency.**
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?
This role sits within the EMEA Digital Center of Excellence organization and as a critical team member, we’re looking for a candidate who has a passion for platform analytics and getting operationally hands-on to support the team in a fast-paced environment. In this role, you will impact our paid campaign execution strategy across various demand generation programs designed to accelerate the buyer's journey and support the customer lifecycle. You will be responsible for supporting the team with their campaign delivery and optimization goals, compiling, and analyzing performance reports to help marketing teams understand the effectiveness of overall marketing and individual campaigns. You will focus on delivering data-driven processes, insights, and recommendations for improvement to meet overall marketing goals and business KPIs.

Description:
¿Quiénes somos?
En Wetaca queremos convertirnos en un movimiento de gente que quiere vivir bien en todos los sentidos. Vivir sin tiempo lleva a muchas personas a tener que elegir entre comer rico y comer sano o a priorizar la rapidez, dejando en un segundo plano la calidad y sabor de lo que comen. Por eso en Wetaca cocinamos para que comas lo que te gustaría cocinar, para que comer sea un sinónimo de disfrute, bienestar y tranquilidad.

Buscamos un/a Data Engineer Lead con vocación de crecimiento que quiera ser una parte activa de la toma de decisiones estratégicas de la empresa.
¿Qué harás?
Definir una estrategia de análisis de datos para toda la empresa con respecto a los procesos ETL, selección de herramientas y flujos de trabajo de datos entre diferentes equipos.

Senior Backend Engineer

sennder is digitalising Europe's logistics. We are a growing team looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. You would join one of our cross-functional engineering teams in Madrid or Barcelona (flexible remote options).

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

As a senior software engineer, you’ll work on designing and building core services, which are instrumental to sennder’s growth. You’ll have the opportunity to build greenfield services and products, influence the design choices of migrating monolith to microservices, and the flexibility to optimize existing code.

You’ll be collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams (6-10 ppl) to develop a solid microservice architecture. You’ll be recognized as an expert by the team, having the autonomy to deliver technically efficient and scalable solutions that have a direct business impact. Our DevOps culture empowers you to own the entire service lifecycle (end-to-end) including infrastructure, supported by our dedicated platform team.

Python, PostgreSQL, AWS, Kafka, Docker, K8S, Terraform, GitLab.

Can you even imagine where we can go with your help? Let’s #KeepOnTrucking... together!

In this role you will

Preferably you have

ABOUT sennder

sennder is moving trucks with the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at unparalleled quality. Through our proprietary transportation operating system, built by our in-house tech teams, we not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we’re growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe’s inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Get to know us, our culture, green business, funding history, and more on our blog here.

What you can expect

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual’s potential for all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit, respect, and kindness to build trusted relationships across teams. Learn more on our career site.

Please send your application in English and help us reduce negative unconscious bias by leaving out your picture, age, address, and other unnecessary information in your CV. We only want to know the merits on which you’d be great for this role.

If you have any questions or problems please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. We do not accept applications via email.

The i2CAT Foundation is looking for a Data Engineer and AI developer who is willing to get involved in two competitive research projects.
The suitable candidate will join the research area of Distributed Artificial Intelligence. The selected candidate that will join i2CAT will work in the following project to deliver AI innovative solutions:
IA Voz, aims to create audio classification models based on deep learning that are deployed in edge devices

Thales people architect solutions at the heart of the defence-security continuum. Interoperable and secure information and telecommunications systems for defence, security, and civil operators, are based upon innovative use of radiocommunications, networks, and cybersecurity. We are ground breaking new digital technologies such as 4G mobile communications, cryptography, cloud computing and big data for use in physical protection systems, and critical information systems.
Thales in Spain is a leader in technological solutions applied to Defence, Aeronautics, Security, Transportation and Space and, furthermore, is a global centre for excellence in Space, Security of Critical Infrastructures and Transportation. With a turnover of €320 million and a staff of 1,200, it exports approximately 40% of its total production principally to the Middle East, North Africa and Latin America.













































At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. Description:
AssemblyAI is a remote-first AI company building powerful deep learning models for developers, startups, and enterprises to transcribe and understand their audio data.
Our ASR models already outperform companies like Google, AWS, and Microsoft - which is why hundreds of companies and thousands of developers are using our APIs to transcribe and understand millions of videos, podcasts, phone calls, and zoom meetings every day. Our APIs power innovative products like conversational intelligence platforms, zoom meeting summarizers, content moderation, and automatic closed captioning.
AssemblyAI's Speech-to-Text APIs are already trusted by Fortune 500s, startups, and thousands of developers around the world, with well-known customers including Spotify, Algolia, Dow Jones, Happy Scribe, BBC, The Wall Street Journal, and NBCUniversal. As part of a huge and emerging market, AssemblyAI is well on its way to becoming the leader in speech recognition and NLP.

Description:
We are Trucksters (http://trucksters.io/), a rising star(tup) in the brand-new digital tech-logistics field and we have an exciting opportunity for an IT Technical Support role.
What do we do? We are a digital transport operator focusing on optimizing long-hauling in Europe. Thanks to our driver relay system that allows multiple drivers to switch between each other, we are improving the standard of trucking.
Who are we? We are a team of young professionals who come from different backgrounds (strategy consulting, sales, tech) and who have a clear mission: we want to create collaboration in the trucking industry to achieve a future where people live better and resources are used more efficiently.
Where are we? We are based in Madrid, although we have a global scope. We have operations in Spain, Germany, The Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, the UK and France.
Our Vision: Our vision is to move the world's road freight in relays to accelerate the electrification agenda and improve drivers' life.

As Milestone continues to grow and expand, we are now strengthening the Software Development department with even more talented Engineers.
The candidate will join our value-added products unit where they will collaborate with current teams, in areas such as Event Server, License Plate Recognition (LPR), Access control or our new vertical bundles integration initiatives. We are a product-driven international team, not project-driven.
We strive at developing and growing people, where honesty and transparency is key among peers. In our department we have a relaxed tone, and all are expected to express their opinion. We are working in self-organized teams and each team is empowered to find solutions.
We are technology driven – we are developing and maintaining one of the most advanced Video Management System (VMS) in the world. We encourage people to innovate and think outside the box to the point where the best ideas materialize into products and features. No idea is too small, and all ideas have the potential to make a difference. We believe our developers have the potential and will to innovate and grow the company even further.

Description:
Senior Backend Engineer

sennder is digitalising Europe's logistics. We are a growing team looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. You would join one of our cross-functional engineering teams in Madrid or Barcelona (flexible remote options).

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

As a senior software engineer, you’ll work on designing and building core services, which are instrumental to sennder’s growth. You’ll have the opportunity to build greenfield services and products, influence the design choices of migrating monolith to microservices, and the flexibility to optimize existing code.

You’ll be collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams (6-10 ppl) to develop a solid microservice architecture. You’ll be recognized as an expert by the team, having the autonomy to deliver technically efficient and scalable solutions that have a direct business impact. Our DevOps culture empowers you to own the entire service lifecycle (end-to-end) including infrastructure, supported by our dedicated platform team.

Python, PostgreSQL, AWS, Kafka, Docker, K8S, Terraform, GitLab.

Can you even imagine where we can go with your help? Let’s #KeepOnTrucking... together!

In this role you will

Preferably you have

ABOUT sennder

sennder is moving trucks with the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at unparalleled quality. Through our proprietary transportation operating system, built by our in-house tech teams, we not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we’re growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe’s inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Get to know us, our culture, green business, funding history, and more on our blog here.

What you can expect

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual’s potential for all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit, respect, and kindness to build trusted relationships across teams. Learn more on our career site.

Please send your application in English and help us reduce negative unconscious bias by leaving out your picture, age, address, and other unnecessary information in your CV. We only want to know the merits on which you’d be great for this role.

If you have any questions or problems please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. We do not accept applications via email.

Our fully extended Technology portfolio includes innovative solutions for Industry 4.0 (Internet of Things, Industrial Edge, Cloud Computing, Big Data, Digital Twin, Cybersecurity, …) which together with the current leader technologies in Automation (Controllers, HMI Systems, SIMATIC, Industrial PCs, TIA Portal, …) allow our customers to reach the next level in the productive processes.

The Technical Presales Consultant is responsible for developing and realizing automation solutions and concepts as well as supporting customers and the Siemens sales force. The successful candidate has technical experience in automation plus exceptional communication and execution skills paired with exceptional organizational skills and business acumen to achieve goals on time.

This is an outstanding opportunity to join a strong team providing the best end to end industrial automation solutions in the market. Siemens is leading the charge in providing innovative solutions to bolster the manufacturing.
The applicant will receive guided, intensive, and continuous training and will take part in a very dynamic team with excellent collaborative colleagues.

Job_title: Digital Operations & Reporting Specialist - Temporary Contract - Opportunity for Working Remotely Madrid,
Description:
**Please note: This is a 12-month, temporary contract and you will be payrolled through our 3rd party agency.**
The Elevator Pitch: Why will you enjoy this new opportunity?
This role sits within the EMEA Digital Center of Excellence organization and as a critical team member, we’re looking for a candidate who has a passion for platform analytics and getting operationally hands-on to support the team in a fast-paced environment. In this role, you will impact our paid campaign execution strategy across various demand generation programs designed to accelerate the buyer's journey and support the customer lifecycle. You will be responsible for supporting the team with their campaign delivery and optimization goals, compiling, and analyzing performance reports to help marketing teams understand the effectiveness of overall marketing and individual campaigns. You will focus on delivering data-driven processes, insights, and recommendations for improvement to meet overall marketing goals and business KPIs.

Job_title: Lead Software Engineer (d/f/m) - Payroll (Madrid, Barcelona or remote Spain)
Description:
The Role
At Personio we are on an amazing journey to becoming the leading HR Platform in Europe!

Join our international agile Product & Engineering team and take an active role in shaping our engineering culture and the future of thousands of HR teams and organizations across Europe. At Personio you will have a direct impact on our product, our users, our organization, and our engineering practices.

We in the Payroll Domain know people like to say: It's not rocket science. But sometimes it just is. The same goes for Payroll. It has been there for some time, there is a way to do it, just as it has always been done. There are rules and regulations, customers and stakeholders, but we just know that there is also another way to do it.



The Payroll Domain is on a mission to make Personio the big player in payroll and offer a smart payroll solution that can handle any kind of employee and use HRM data blended into payroll. Using our services, our customers save tons of money and time - and HR Managers can delegate the most complex tasks to us so they can gain peace of mind and focus on what really matters: people.

Like all our tribes we are a cross-functional group of engineers, designers, and product managers from many different nationalities and backgrounds, spread across different locations and we continue to grow in 2021. Join us and help shape the Payroll Domain journey for Personio.

, you will be a bar raiser in a mission-based team within the Personio Engineering organization and take care of team productivity, technical alignment, and technical growth. In this role, you will act as a multiplier for your team

You know how to address each challenge - coding hands-on to prototype a solution, holding technical presentations, or conducting brainstorming sessions with engineers from other tribes to tackle a certain problem - You know it best!!

This is a high-impact role and you will be in the lead to creating the long-term technical strategy for one of Personio’s main product components and represent the team in Personio’s Product & Engineering department.

Description:
Who we are:
Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.

We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet—and at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.

Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, London, San Antonio, Spokane and remote locations. We’ve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington’s Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.

Description:
Company Description:
We are Merkle, a performance marketing agency which specialises in the delivery of personalised
customer experiences across platforms and devices. We call it ‘people-based’ marketing, and we are proud to be recognised as an industry leader.
Our head office is in Columbia, Maryland and our expansion in Europe started in 2015 with the acquisition of three European companies: Persicopix, DBG and Comet. In 2016, we joined the Dentsu Aegis Network, one of the world’s biggest Global media companies.
Merkle’s heritage in data, technology and analytics is the foundation for our understanding of consumer insights that drives our people-based marketing strategies. With our expertise, we can offer our clients content-driven, contextual and compelling customer journeys and experiences that drive business growth.

Description:
Currently enrolled in or will receive a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree with a graduation date between September 2023 and December 2024.
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related fields at time of application
Although no specific programming language is required – you should be familiar with the syntax of languages such as Java, C/C++ or Python

We’re on the lookout for the curious, those who think big and want to define the world of tomorrow. At Amazon, you will grow into the high impact, visionary person you know you’re ready to be. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth.

How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you’ll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow.

This role is located in Spain and you only need to apply once, we will take your location preferences into consideration and we talk to you about it once you have passed your final stage interview.

Key job responsibilities

About the team
If you’re insatiably curious and always want to learn more, then you’ve come to the right place. Depending on your location, country, job status and other requirements, some or all of the following benefits may be available to you as an intern.

If you’re successful during your internship, you could be considered for a graduate role after finishing your university studies.

Internship start dates vary throughout the year.
Internship length can vary between 3 to 6 months full-time or 6-12 months part-time.

Applications and Assessment Process: Selected candidates will be invited to an online assessment, if successful you’ll attend a virtual interview consisting of a combination of interviews and case studies, focusing on our Leadership Principles. This selection process is subject to change and varies on role and location.

We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and leveraging our unique perspectives to scale our impact and grow. Amazon has 13 affinity groups (https://www.aboutamazon.com/affinity-groups), sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. With executive and company sponsorship, these groups play an important role in building internal networks for creating a community, advising Amazon business units, leading in service projects, and reaching out to communities where Amazonians live and work.

Want to know more about our opportunities? Visit our EMEA Student Programs Team Events page to register for one of our upcoming events: https://amazonstudentevents.splashthat.com/careers

Company_name: Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputación
Job_title: Data Engineer for Language and Translation Technologies (RE2)
Description:
Context And Mission

The Language Technologies (LT) Unit at BSC has a consolidated experience in several NLP areas, such as massive language model building, biomedical text mining, machine translation and unsupervised learning. It has been entrusted by the Spanish and the Catalan government with the mission to develop essential open-source resources and technologies for Spanish and Catalan. In connection with this, the LT Unit is currently in charge of two flagship projects at the national and regional levels: the Spanish National Plan for the Advancement of Language Technology, funded by the Spanish Secretariat of Digitalisation and Artificial Intelligence, and the AINA project, aimed at developing AI resources for Catalan, funded by the Catalan Digitalisation Department. In addition, the Unit participates in various EU-funded international projects.

AssemblyAI is a remote-first AI company building powerful deep learning models for developers, startups, and enterprises to transcribe and understand their audio data.
Our ASR models already outperform companies like Google, AWS, and Microsoft - which is why hundreds of companies and thousands of developers are using our APIs to transcribe and understand millions of videos, podcasts, phone calls, and zoom meetings every day. Our APIs power innovative products like conversational intelligence platforms, zoom meeting summarizers, content moderation, and automatic closed captioning.
AssemblyAI's Speech-to-Text APIs are already trusted by Fortune 500s, startups, and thousands of developers around the world, with well-known customers including Spotify, Algolia, Dow Jones, Happy Scribe, BBC, The Wall Street Journal, and NBCUniversal. As part of a huge and emerging market, AssemblyAI is well on its way to becoming the leader in speech recognition and NLP.

Description:
We are Trucksters (http://trucksters.io/), a rising star(tup) in the brand-new digital tech-logistics field and we have an exciting opportunity for an IT Technical Support role.
What do we do? We are a digital transport operator focusing on optimizing long-hauling in Europe. Thanks to our driver relay system that allows multiple drivers to switch between each other, we are improving the standard of trucking.
Who are we? We are a team of young professionals who come from different backgrounds (strategy consulting, sales, tech) and who have a clear mission: we want to create collaboration in the trucking industry to achieve a future where people live better and resources are used more efficiently.
Where are we? We are based in Madrid, although we have a global scope. We have operations in Spain, Germany, The Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, the UK and France.
Our Vision: Our vision is to move the world's road freight in relays to accelerate the electrification agenda and improve drivers' life.

Description:
Kapsch TrafficCom develops smart solutions to make mobility safer, more sustainable and efficient for everybody. We design, build and operate traffic management systems including connected vehicles technology and mobility demand management as well as tolling services for cities, roads, tunnels and bridges around the world. We develop data and video analytics platforms, building on state-of-the-art technologies including AI, machine learning, big data and cloud services to enable the digitalization of mobility.
This recruitment process is for an international team, so please submit your resume in English.
We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer. If you have a proficient background in information technology with a specific focus on ML related to Data Science/Engineering and you´re passionate about mobility and traffic data in this field, apply for the role and grow with us!

Job_title: Windchill & A400M PDM backbone technical and functional engineer (m/f)
Description:
Job Description:
Company Description:
Airbus Defence and Space is a division of Airbus Group, formed by combining the business activities of Cassidian, Astrium and AirbusMilitary. This new division is the leading Aerospace and Defence Company in Europe; it represents the second largest company in the space field and is among the ten best international defence companies. It has annual revenue of around €14 billion and employs approximately 40,000 people.

Job Description:
Within Airbus Defence and Space, Information Management (IM) plays a key role as a central function, involved in all business and technical
processes.
Product Data Management (PDM) and Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) are at the heart of all Airbus Defence and Space products and
programs.
Joining our team you will contribute to the success of our challenging satellites development programs, fascinating space exploration missions or innovating defense projects.
You will be joining a multi-cultural team (7) that are based throughout Europe. As such, this position will require potential travelling (not considering sanitary crisis period).

Job_title: Lead Software Engineer (d/f/m) - Payroll (Madrid, Barcelona or remote Spain)
Description:
The Role
At Personio we are on an amazing journey to becoming the leading HR Platform in Europe!

Join our international agile Product & Engineering team and take an active role in shaping our engineering culture and the future of thousands of HR teams and organizations across Europe. At Personio you will have a direct impact on our product, our users, our organization, and our engineering practices.

We in the Payroll Domain know people like to say: It's not rocket science. But sometimes it just is. The same goes for Payroll. It has been there for some time, there is a way to do it, just as it has always been done. There are rules and regulations, customers and stakeholders, but we just know that there is also another way to do it.



The Payroll Domain is on a mission to make Personio the big player in payroll and offer a smart payroll solution that can handle any kind of employee and use HRM data blended into payroll. Using our services, our customers save tons of money and time - and HR Managers can delegate the most complex tasks to us so they can gain peace of mind and focus on what really matters: people.

Like all our tribes we are a cross-functional group of engineers, designers, and product managers from many different nationalities and backgrounds, spread across different locations and we continue to grow in 2021. Join us and help shape the Payroll Domain journey for Personio.

, you will be a bar raiser in a mission-based team within the Personio Engineering organization and take care of team productivity, technical alignment, and technical growth. In this role, you will act as a multiplier for your team

You know how to address each challenge - coding hands-on to prototype a solution, holding technical presentations, or conducting brainstorming sessions with engineers from other tribes to tackle a certain problem - You know it best!!

This is a high-impact role and you will be in the lead to creating the long-term technical strategy for one of Personio’s main product components and represent the team in Personio’s Product & Engineering department.

We're passionate about building tools that help small and medium-sized businesses market, sell, and serve their customers — and ultimately, grow better. The Product Platform Group is on a mission to help our customers use HubSpot better. This means that our internal and external users can rely on us, can focus on their most meaningful work, and achieve results faster.
The tools our teams build allow our customers to control and configure their brand identities and organize their assets, data and teams. These tools and services will help our customers get exponentially better at collaborating easily inside the HubSpot product.
Engineers in our group can expect to work in small, autonomous teams and have full ownership over their apps. This team works with Java, Kafka, MySQL and ElasticSearch.

Description:
Senior Backend Engineer

sennder is digitalising Europe's logistics. We are a growing team looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. You would join one of our cross-functional engineering teams in Madrid or Barcelona (flexible remote options).

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

As a senior software engineer, you’ll work on designing and building core services, which are instrumental to sennder’s growth. You’ll have the opportunity to build greenfield services and products, influence the design choices of migrating monolith to microservices, and the flexibility to optimize existing code.

You’ll be collaborating closely with our cross-functional teams (6-10 ppl) to develop a solid microservice architecture. You’ll be recognized as an expert by the team, having the autonomy to deliver technically efficient and scalable solutions that have a direct business impact. Our DevOps culture empowers you to own the entire service lifecycle (end-to-end) including infrastructure, supported by our dedicated platform team.

Python, PostgreSQL, AWS, Kafka, Docker, K8S, Terraform, GitLab.

Can you even imagine where we can go with your help? Let’s #KeepOnTrucking... together!

In this role you will

Preferably you have

ABOUT sennder

sennder is moving trucks with the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at unparalleled quality. Through our proprietary transportation operating system, built by our in-house tech teams, we not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we’re growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe’s inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Get to know us, our culture, green business, funding history, and more on our blog here.

What you can expect

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual’s potential for all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit, respect, and kindness to build trusted relationships across teams. Learn more on our career site.

Please send your application in English and help us reduce negative unconscious bias by leaving out your picture, age, address, and other unnecessary information in your CV. We only want to know the merits on which you’d be great for this role.

If you have any questions or problems please reach out to us at ta@sennder.com. We do not accept applications via email.

Job_title: Industrial engineer. Technical Consultant for Factory Automation with focus PLC/HMI (m/f/d)
Description:
Siemens, global company leading in technology and a step ahead of digital transformation of industries thanks to the Digital Enterprise, has an open position in The Factory Automation Business Unit as Technical Presales Consultant for PLC and HMI in Tres Cantos, Madrid.
Our fully extended Technology portfolio includes innovative solutions for Industry 4.0 (Internet of Things, Industrial Edge, Cloud Computing, Big Data, Digital Twin, Cybersecurity, …) which together with the current leader technologies in Automation (Controllers, HMI Systems, SIMATIC, Industrial PCs, TIA Portal, …) allow our customers to reach the next level in the productive processes.

The Technical Presales Consultant is responsible for developing and realizing automation solutions and concepts as well as supporting customers and the Siemens sales force. The successful candidate has technical experience in automation plus exceptional communication and execution skills paired with exceptional organizational skills and business acumen to achieve goals on time.

This is an outstanding opportunity to join a strong team providing the best end to end industrial automation solutions in the market. Siemens is leading the charge in providing innovative solutions to bolster the manufacturing.
The applicant will receive guided, intensive, and continuous training and will take part in a very dynamic team with excellent collaborative colleagues.

We’re on the lookout for the curious, those who think big and want to define the world of tomorrow. At Amazon, you will grow into the high impact, visionary person you know you’re ready to be. Every day will be filled with exciting new challenges, developing new skills, and achieving personal growth.

How often can you say that your work changes the world? At Amazon, you’ll say it often. Join us and define tomorrow.

This role is located in Spain and you only need to apply once, we will take your location preferences into consideration and we talk to you about it once you have passed your final stage interview.

Key job responsibilities

About the team
If you’re insatiably curious and always want to learn more, then you’ve come to the right place. Depending on your location, country, job status and other requirements, some or all of the following benefits may be available to you as an intern.

If you’re successful during your internship, you could be considered for a graduate role after finishing your university studies.

Internship start dates vary throughout the year.
Internship length can vary between 3 to 6 months full-time or 6-12 months part-time.

Applications and Assessment Process: Selected candidates will be invited to an online assessment, if successful you’ll attend a virtual interview consisting of a combination of interviews and case studies, focusing on our Leadership Principles. This selection process is subject to change and varies on role and location.

We are committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, and leveraging our unique perspectives to scale our impact and grow. Amazon has 13 affinity groups (https://www.aboutamazon.com/affinity-groups), sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. With executive and company sponsorship, these groups play an important role in building internal networks for creating a community, advising Amazon business units, leading in service projects, and reaching out to communities where Amazonians live and work.

Want to know more about our opportunities? Visit our EMEA Student Programs Team Events page to register for one of our upcoming events: https://amazonstudentevents.splashthat.com/careers
