Job_title: Database Developer / Data Engineer | Azure & BI
Description:
For over 25 years, hundreds of companies at thousands of locations all over Europe rely on our ever-evolving solutions and platforms to integrate their infrastructure, connect with their business partners, and transform and exchange their data. We process millions of business-critical documents each year – like orders, invoices, product catalogues, inventory, and price data.
Our next big leap is to build a unique Business Intelligence and Automation Platform. We call it FXM – Feedback & Experience Management. It utilizes vast amounts of industry data to provide real-time and easy-to-use reports for business leaders. This enables them to get unique insights and make critical business decisions putting them ahead of their competition.
Your Role

Who we are:
Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.

We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet—and at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.

Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, London, San Antonio, Spokane and remote locations. We’ve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington’s Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.

Description:
We are Trucksters (http://trucksters.io/), a rising star(tup) in the brand-new digital tech-logistics field and we have an exciting opportunity for an IT Technical Support role.
What do we do? We are a digital transport operator focusing on optimizing long-hauling in Europe. Thanks to our driver relay system that allows multiple drivers to switch between each other, we are improving the standard of trucking.
Who are we? We are a team of young professionals who come from different backgrounds (strategy consulting, sales, tech) and who have a clear mission: we want to create collaboration in the trucking industry to achieve a future where people live better and resources are used more efficiently.
Where are we? We are based in Madrid, although we have a global scope. We have operations in Spain, Germany, The Netherlands, Belgium, Poland, the UK and France.
Our Vision: Our vision is to move the world's road freight in relays to accelerate the electrification agenda and improve drivers' life.

Description:
Experis es una gran compañía especializada en soluciones de atracción y gestión de Talento en tecnologías de la información.
Siguiendo con la consolidación como empresa referente en el sector y continuando con la línea crecimiento, buscamos incorporar en cliente un perfil con al menos tres años de experiencia como DATA ENGINEER para el área de BigData, con los requisitos que se detallan a continuación:
• Experiencia mínima en Proyectos con Arquitectura Big Data de 2 años
• Experiencia mínima de 3 años en desarrollo:
• Integración y tratamiento datos (batch y real time) con tecnología Spark
• Ingeniería de procesos de inteligencia artificial (preparación data set de entrada, tratamiento data set de salida, industrialización de código, ...)
• Tiene sólida experiencia en desarrollo, preferiblemente con Java y Python. Se requieren conocimientos de Scala y R
• Alto conocimiento de SQL

Valorables:
• Conocimiento del sector seguros
• Conocimiento de tecnologías de extracción de datos digitales: Supermetrics, BigQuery, etc…
• Conocimiento de técnicas de DevOps/DataOps
• Conocimiento en otras herramientas BI de integración de datos, analítica o reporting tales como OAS, Power BI, Informatica PowerCenter, Data Quality.

Competencias:
• Proactivo e innovador a la hora de buscar nuevas alternativas.
• Trabajo en equipo
• Persona metódica y rigurosa.
• Capacidad de gestionar diversas peticiones y proyectos en paralelo

Description:
Company Description:
We are Merkle, a performance marketing agency which specialises in the delivery of personalised
customer experiences across platforms and devices. We call it ‘people-based’ marketing, and we are proud to be recognised as an industry leader.
Our head office is in Columbia, Maryland and our expansion in Europe started in 2015 with the acquisition of three European companies: Persicopix, DBG and Comet. In 2016, we joined the Dentsu Aegis Network, one of the world’s biggest Global media companies.
Merkle’s heritage in data, technology and analytics is the foundation for our understanding of consumer insights that drives our people-based marketing strategies. With our expertise, we can offer our clients content-driven, contextual and compelling customer journeys and experiences that drive business growth.

Description:
AssemblyAI is a remote-first AI company building powerful deep learning models for developers, startups, and enterprises to transcribe and understand their audio data.
Our ASR models already outperform companies like Google, AWS, and Microsoft - which is why hundreds of companies and thousands of developers are using our APIs to transcribe and understand millions of videos, podcasts, phone calls, and zoom meetings every day. Our APIs power innovative products like conversational intelligence platforms, zoom meeting summarizers, content moderation, and automatic closed captioning.
AssemblyAI's Speech-to-Text APIs are already trusted by Fortune 500s, startups, and thousands of developers around the world, with well-known customers including Spotify, Algolia, Dow Jones, Happy Scribe, BBC, The Wall Street Journal, and NBCUniversal. As part of a huge and emerging market, AssemblyAI is well on its way to becoming the leader in speech recognition and NLP.

Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Description:
Data Engineer en Asturias.
Perfil buscado (Hombre/Mujer)

The Data Engineer will join the fast-growing analytics team and will have a high impact on a strategic digital transformation initiative with opportunities for career advancement as the team grows.

Analytics team uses the Azure Data Lake and Microsoft Power BI to provide analytics solutions and business data insights to a wide range of functions including sales supply chain operations and finance. As a specialist in our team you will be responsible for expanding this service and ensuring its continuing reliability and performance by leading initiatives to connect new data sources enhance existing data sources and manage intersections with external teams and processes.

Position activities include
Interface with enterprise architects to facilitate architecture security reviews for analytics applications
Provide administrative support for services related to analytics platforms including
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data Lake
Databricks
SQL Server
Ensure that applications have appropriate security models designed and applied
Maintain the Lakehouse architecture in ADLS using Databricks
Work with DevOps team to deploy solutions in production environments
Lead projects that include other team members and participate in projects led by other team members
Collaborate with team members across the world to share key learnings leverage ideas and solutions and to propagate best practices
Apply change management tools including training communication and documentation to manage upgrades changes and data migrations
Analyze and resolve issues and work with service providers to minimize the risk of recurrence

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment Data Engineer (Azure Databricks-Azure Data factory)

The Data Engineer to be qualified for this role must possess the following
Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area
4-7 years of relevant IT experience (Data Analytics Data Engineering)
Strong communication skills in English language (both written and spoken)
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them
Ability to coordinate with various teams across different functions
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as guide other team members
Ability to be an effective team member with remote colleagues spread across the world
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience with Azure platform (incl. ADF and ADLS)
Extensive experience in data concepts and tools
Preference will be given to candidates with these skills
Delta lake and Lakehouse architecture
Pandas and PySpark
Exposure to DevOps workflows
SQL

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment

Interesting professional opportunity based in Asturias.

Hybrid model

Azure Data,Databricks,SQL Server

Description:
ShopFully is the tech company reinventing local shopping worldwide.

Thanks to our marketplaces we enable 45+ million users globally to save money and time when shopping at their favourite local stores. Our AI-driven platform helps 400+ retailers and top brands reach their ideal audiences and finally drive them to their stores, boosting local sales. This is why today we are one of the leading international players in Drive to Store.

We’re a team of over 370, spanning 30 different nationalities across 12 countries. Are you ready to join us?

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL

You will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable ETL processes towards the enterprise data warehouse and data lake
You will take care of everything related to the use of data to support the sale and improvement of our products (e.g. search for products loopholes), from the data ingestion phase to the visualization phase
your relational skills will be an advantage in the analysis and definition of data processes that meet business requirements
Our data platform is completely in the AWS cloud, it is modern and inspired by the big technological players and allows us to manage both batch and real-time applications.

SKILLS WE’RE SEARCHING FOR

You have a good knowledge of the SQL language and Python
You have knowledge of the basics of Big Data application development
You have knowledge of the cloud world and in particular AWS
You are able to work in a team and coordinate with multiple internal stakeholders

OTHER ABILITIES THAT WILL WIN OUR HEART

You have knowledge of the basics of the dimensional fact model and data warehousing
You have knowledge of at least one ETL tool (Pentaho Data Integration, Talend, etc.)
PySpark
It should be a plus also if you have knowledge of Tableau and R

THIS IS WHAT YOU’LL FIND IF YOU START THE ADVENTURE WITH US

Zero degrees of separation.
We are very informal, love direct feedback and work by project, so you’ll get a chance to meet everyone. Our CEO, CTO and C-anything will be your colleagues in some activities and you’ll get to work with all of us!

Massive impact.
You’ll work on tech & products that will be used by hundreds of retailers and brands and millions of people (from your friends, to your neighbours, and maybe even your mother!).

Problems that you’ll love to solve.
Here, you’ll discover that every challenge is an opportunity to thrive and make an impact.

The best team you’ve ever met.
We’re young and talented, without being divas, and we are supportive of each other. We share knowledge and are each other’s number one fans.

Learning and growing.
What do you think about 70 hours Learning Time a year and the possibility of getting tech certifications like AWS? But most importantly, at ShopFully you’ll be learning by doing and making mistakes, which will allow you to improve day after day.

Smart working, but even smarter.
each team can choose the ShopFully Hub that suits them better. Rome, Sidney or Barcelona? You’ll be spoilt for choice!

Fun, fun, fun!
It can be a happy hour, a volleyball match, a tandem ride, a Halloween party. You name it!

Lunches on us.
We give meal vouchers, also while working remotely. It’s a little thing, but we want to take care of it.

Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Description:
We are EA
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform.
We are hiring a Data Engineering Intern for our Localization Data & AI team. Loc Data & AI ́s mission is to support and foster the use of data from all perspectives, along with the development of policies and procedures for the monitoring and active management of data in EA Localization. And our means include building data engineering products and solutions, such as integrating data from various sources such as APIs, databases, and file systems.
This includes an understanding of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) techniques.







We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

Description:
ShopFully is the tech company reinventing local shopping worldwide.

Thanks to our marketplaces we enable 45+ million users globally to save money and time when shopping at their favourite local stores. Our AI-driven platform helps 400+ retailers and top brands reach their ideal audiences and finally drive them to their stores, boosting local sales. This is why today we are one of the leading international players in Drive to Store.

We’re a team of over 370, spanning 30 different nationalities across 12 countries. Are you ready to join us?

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL

You will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable ETL processes towards the enterprise data warehouse and data lake
You will take care of everything related to the use of data to support the sale and improvement of our products (e.g. search for products loopholes), from the data ingestion phase to the visualization phase
your relational skills will be an advantage in the analysis and definition of data processes that meet business requirements
Our data platform is completely in the AWS cloud, it is modern and inspired by the big technological players and allows us to manage both batch and real-time applications.

SKILLS WE’RE SEARCHING FOR

You have a good knowledge of the SQL language and Python
You have knowledge of the basics of Big Data application development
You have knowledge of the cloud world and in particular AWS
You are able to work in a team and coordinate with multiple internal stakeholders

OTHER ABILITIES THAT WILL WIN OUR HEART

You have knowledge of the basics of the dimensional fact model and data warehousing
You have knowledge of at least one ETL tool (Pentaho Data Integration, Talend, etc.)
PySpark
It should be a plus also if you have knowledge of Tableau and R

THIS IS WHAT YOU’LL FIND IF YOU START THE ADVENTURE WITH US

Zero degrees of separation.
We are very informal, love direct feedback and work by project, so you’ll get a chance to meet everyone. Our CEO, CTO and C-anything will be your colleagues in some activities and you’ll get to work with all of us!

Massive impact.
You’ll work on tech & products that will be used by hundreds of retailers and brands and millions of people (from your friends, to your neighbours, and maybe even your mother!).

Problems that you’ll love to solve.
Here, you’ll discover that every challenge is an opportunity to thrive and make an impact.

The best team you’ve ever met.
We’re young and talented, without being divas, and we are supportive of each other. We share knowledge and are each other’s number one fans.

Learning and growing.
What do you think about 70 hours Learning Time a year and the possibility of getting tech certifications like AWS? But most importantly, at ShopFully you’ll be learning by doing and making mistakes, which will allow you to improve day after day.

Smart working, but even smarter.
each team can choose the ShopFully Hub that suits them better. Rome, Sidney or Barcelona? You’ll be spoilt for choice!

Fun, fun, fun!
It can be a happy hour, a volleyball match, a tandem ride, a Halloween party. You name it!

Lunches on us.
We give meal vouchers, also while working remotely. It’s a little thing, but we want to take care of it.

Data Engineer/Power BI Developer en Barcelona.
¿Te interesa desarrollarte como Data Engineer/Power BI Developer dentro de un entorno profesional dinámico y altamente cualificado en el cual podrás trabajar con altos volúmenes de datos?

Desde Oxigent Technologies consultora tecnológica seleccionamos Data Engineers y/o Power BI Developers para participar en diferentes proyectos dentro del ámbito BigData y ubicados en Barcelona

Te incorporarías a diferentes equipos del área de Business Solutions Data Infraestructuras entre otras... y tus principales funciones serán
Construcción de las apps y los objetos en Microsoft Power BI

Para ello ¿Qué necesitamos?
Y llegados a este punto... ¿Qué te ofrecemos?
data, bi, sql, python, powerbi, scala, spark, snowflake, git, databricks

Barcelona - Data Engineer - Full time
1.300€/mes
Última actualización: December 2, 2021
Sobre la posición
IOMED es una empresa especializada en la extracción y el procesamiento de datos médicos a través de herramientas de Inteligencia Artificial como Machine Learning y Procesamiento de Lenguaje Natural. Estructuramos la información clínica con el objetivo de acelerar la investigación clínica.
Tu función principal será trabajar en el análisis de datos de la industria médica aplicando mejoras en nuestros procesos, con el objetivo de asegurar la calidad del dato. Formarás parte de un equipo multidisciplinar con el que colaborarás diariamente en proyectos en el cual podrás aprender e impulsar nuevas ideas.

EDPR is committed to furthering social advances in terms of sustainability and integration. Description:
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation, you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.
The Role
Veeva Link seeks a mid to senior Python Data Engineer that will participate in all aspects of architecting and developing new and innovative data pipelines and data handling. You will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology and new product development in an established company that is rapidly growing. This is a great opportunity for an engineer looking to expand their well-established career, who is excited about search, solving complex problems, ownership, and who enjoys working with technologies like Python, ElasticSearch, and AWS.

Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Description:
Field Service Engineer en Barcelona.
Perfil buscado (Hombre/Mujer)

The Field Service Engineer will have the following responsibilities
Install (mechanical cabling) configure and start-up (commissioning) equipment at customer site as per pre-defined specifications.
Maintain adjust and replace on site devices of existing customer systems.
Follow rigorously safety and security on site company procedures.
Escalate to upper technical level problems that cant be solved independently.
Issue timely and accurate service reports (including expenses report).
Extend or help building a respectful relationship with customer by always adopting an exemplary attitude.

Multinational company leader in automatic data capture and process automation Project with high impact in the company and visibility

The Field Service Engineer must meet the following requirements
Associate or Bachelor degree in a technical field such as electronics networking
Fluent in Spanish and English Intermediate level.
2/3 years of experience on Field Service Activities in automation or other similar market with Electrical and Electronical devices.
Electrical Schematics reading.
Troubleshooting and diagnostic experience of hardware and software
Remote PC diagnostic and remedy support.
Good understanding of computer networks.
PLC communications experience Device-net Profinet Profibus.
Experience working with auto ID products.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Software (MS Dynamics is a plus).
Good communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to travel domestic and UE (mainly Spain) extensively (up to 85 of time)
Willing to work during alternative work schedules such as weekend and/or overnight.

Description:
Data Engineer en Asturias.
Perfil buscado (Hombre/Mujer)

The Data Engineer will join the fast-growing analytics team and will have a high impact on a strategic digital transformation initiative with opportunities for career advancement as the team grows.

Analytics team uses the Azure Data Lake and Microsoft Power BI to provide analytics solutions and business data insights to a wide range of functions including sales supply chain operations and finance. As a specialist in our team you will be responsible for expanding this service and ensuring its continuing reliability and performance by leading initiatives to connect new data sources enhance existing data sources and manage intersections with external teams and processes.

Position activities include
Interface with enterprise architects to facilitate architecture security reviews for analytics applications
Provide administrative support for services related to analytics platforms including
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data Lake
Databricks
SQL Server
Ensure that applications have appropriate security models designed and applied
Maintain the Lakehouse architecture in ADLS using Databricks
Work with DevOps team to deploy solutions in production environments
Lead projects that include other team members and participate in projects led by other team members
Collaborate with team members across the world to share key learnings leverage ideas and solutions and to propagate best practices
Apply change management tools including training communication and documentation to manage upgrades changes and data migrations
Analyze and resolve issues and work with service providers to minimize the risk of recurrence

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment Data Engineer (Azure Databricks-Azure Data factory)

The Data Engineer to be qualified for this role must possess the following
Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area
4-7 years of relevant IT experience (Data Analytics Data Engineering)
Strong communication skills in English language (both written and spoken)
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them
Ability to coordinate with various teams across different functions
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as guide other team members
Ability to be an effective team member with remote colleagues spread across the world
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience with Azure platform (incl. ADF and ADLS)
Extensive experience in data concepts and tools
Preference will be given to candidates with these skills
Delta lake and Lakehouse architecture
Pandas and PySpark
Exposure to DevOps workflows
SQL

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment

Interesting professional opportunity based in Asturias.

Hybrid model

Azure Data,Databricks,SQL Server

Description:
We are EA
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are hiring a Data Engineering Intern for our Localization Data & AI team. Description:
Localidad
Madrid

Funciones:
Desde Grupo Hasten estamos seleccionando perfiles de Data Engineer junior con experiencia trabajando con python para uno de nuestros clientes con sede en Madrid.
Requisitos:

ShopFully is the tech company reinventing local shopping worldwide.

Thanks to our marketplaces we enable 45+ million users globally to save money and time when shopping at their favourite local stores. Our AI-driven platform helps 400+ retailers and top brands reach their ideal audiences and finally drive them to their stores, boosting local sales. This is why today we are one of the leading international players in Drive to Store.

We’re a team of over 370, spanning 30 different nationalities across 12 countries. Are you ready to join us?

IN THIS ROLE, YOU WILL

You will be responsible for designing and implementing scalable ETL processes towards the enterprise data warehouse and data lake
You will take care of everything related to the use of data to support the sale and improvement of our products (e.g. search for products loopholes), from the data ingestion phase to the visualization phase
your relational skills will be an advantage in the analysis and definition of data processes that meet business requirements
Our data platform is completely in the AWS cloud, it is modern and inspired by the big technological players and allows us to manage both batch and real-time applications.

SKILLS WE’RE SEARCHING FOR

You have a good knowledge of the SQL language and Python
You have knowledge of the basics of Big Data application development
You have knowledge of the cloud world and in particular AWS
You are able to work in a team and coordinate with multiple internal stakeholders

OTHER ABILITIES THAT WILL WIN OUR HEART

You have knowledge of the basics of the dimensional fact model and data warehousing
You have knowledge of at least one ETL tool (Pentaho Data Integration, Talend, etc.)
PySpark
It should be a plus also if you have knowledge of Tableau and R

THIS IS WHAT YOU’LL FIND IF YOU START THE ADVENTURE WITH US

Zero degrees of separation.
We are very informal, love direct feedback and work by project, so you’ll get a chance to meet everyone. Our CEO, CTO and C-anything will be your colleagues in some activities and you’ll get to work with all of us!

Massive impact.
You’ll work on tech & products that will be used by hundreds of retailers and brands and millions of people (from your friends, to your neighbours, and maybe even your mother!).

Problems that you’ll love to solve.
Here, you’ll discover that every challenge is an opportunity to thrive and make an impact.

The best team you’ve ever met.
We’re young and talented, without being divas, and we are supportive of each other. We share knowledge and are each other’s number one fans.

Learning and growing.
What do you think about 70 hours Learning Time a year and the possibility of getting tech certifications like AWS? But most importantly, at ShopFully you’ll be learning by doing and making mistakes, which will allow you to improve day after day.

Smart working, but even smarter.
each team can choose the ShopFully Hub that suits them better. Rome, Sidney or Barcelona? You’ll be spoilt for choice!

Fun, fun, fun!
It can be a happy hour, a volleyball match, a tandem ride, a Halloween party. You name it!

Lunches on us.
We give meal vouchers, also while working remotely. It’s a little thing, but we want to take care of it.

Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Description:
Data Engineer en Asturias.
Perfil buscado (Hombre/Mujer)

The Data Engineer will join the fast-growing analytics team and will have a high impact on a strategic digital transformation initiative with opportunities for career advancement as the team grows.

Analytics team uses the Azure Data Lake and Microsoft Power BI to provide analytics solutions and business data insights to a wide range of functions including sales supply chain operations and finance. As a specialist in our team you will be responsible for expanding this service and ensuring its continuing reliability and performance by leading initiatives to connect new data sources enhance existing data sources and manage intersections with external teams and processes.

Interface with enterprise architects to facilitate architecture security reviews for analytics applications
Provide administrative support for services related to analytics platforms including
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data Lake
Databricks
SQL Server
Ensure that applications have appropriate security models designed and applied
Maintain the Lakehouse architecture in ADLS using Databricks
Work with DevOps team to deploy solutions in production environments
Lead projects that include other team members and participate in projects led by other team members
Collaborate with team members across the world to share key learnings leverage ideas and solutions and to propagate best practices
Apply change management tools including training communication and documentation to manage upgrades changes and data migrations
Analyze and resolve issues and work with service providers to minimize the risk of recurrence

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment Data Engineer (Azure Databricks-Azure Data factory)

Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area
4-7 years of relevant IT experience (Data Analytics Data Engineering)
Strong communication skills in English language (both written and spoken)
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them
Ability to coordinate with various teams across different functions
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as guide other team members
Ability to be an effective team member with remote colleagues spread across the world
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience with Azure platform (incl. ADF and ADLS)
Extensive experience in data concepts and tools
Preference will be given to candidates with these skills
Delta lake and Lakehouse architecture
Pandas and PySpark
Exposure to DevOps workflows
SQL

We are EA
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! Desde Grupo Hasten estamos seleccionando perfiles de Data Engineer junior con experiencia trabajando con python para uno de nuestros clientes con sede en Madrid.
Requisitos:

Data Engineer and Analytics
JOB CONTEXT
Sanofi is globally deploying its new core model ERP covering Finance, SBS, Supply Chain, Trade, Manufacturing, Quality, Plant maintenance, warehouse management across all GBUs - through the implementation of a Global ERP (iSHIFT project) using SAP S4/HANA technology. All this together with other Core Solutions like QMS, LIMS and MES require strong data foundations to boost the integration between those solutions and provide a data platform to sustain the built of Digital Products.
JOB OVERVIEW
Within the Digital Analytics CoE team, Junior Data/Software Engineer will design and build solutions across different project to provide data for analytics / BI needs of different IA and Finance Ops products.
JOB SUMMARY
You will be part of a multidisciplinary team that works on the end-to-end needs of the analytics chain for Industrial Affairs & Finance Ops of the Sanofi group. You will deploy a data engineering pipeline and integration solutions with technically robust lifecycle management (e.g. new releases, change management, monitoring and troubleshooting) to provide this team with reliable datasets / KPIs.

Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Description:
Data Engineer en Asturias.
Perfil buscado (Hombre/Mujer)

The Data Engineer will join the fast-growing analytics team and will have a high impact on a strategic digital transformation initiative with opportunities for career advancement as the team grows.

Analytics team uses the Azure Data Lake and Microsoft Power BI to provide analytics solutions and business data insights to a wide range of functions including sales supply chain operations and finance. As a specialist in our team you will be responsible for expanding this service and ensuring its continuing reliability and performance by leading initiatives to connect new data sources enhance existing data sources and manage intersections with external teams and processes.

Position activities include
Interface with enterprise architects to facilitate architecture security reviews for analytics applications
Provide administrative support for services related to analytics platforms including
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data Lake
Databricks
SQL Server
Ensure that applications have appropriate security models designed and applied
Maintain the Lakehouse architecture in ADLS using Databricks
Work with DevOps team to deploy solutions in production environments
Lead projects that include other team members and participate in projects led by other team members
Collaborate with team members across the world to share key learnings leverage ideas and solutions and to propagate best practices
Apply change management tools including training communication and documentation to manage upgrades changes and data migrations
Analyze and resolve issues and work with service providers to minimize the risk of recurrence

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment Data Engineer (Azure Databricks-Azure Data factory)

The Data Engineer to be qualified for this role must possess the following
Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area
4-7 years of relevant IT experience (Data Analytics Data Engineering)
Strong communication skills in English language (both written and spoken)
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them
Ability to coordinate with various teams across different functions
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as guide other team members
Ability to be an effective team member with remote colleagues spread across the world
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience with Azure platform (incl. ADF and ADLS)
Extensive experience in data concepts and tools
Preference will be given to candidates with these skills
Delta lake and Lakehouse architecture
Pandas and PySpark
Exposure to DevOps workflows
SQL

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment

Interesting professional opportunity based in Asturias.

Hybrid model

Azure Data,Databricks,SQL Server

Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Databricks

Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area

Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them

Description:
We are EA
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform.
We are hiring a Data Engineering Intern for our Localization Data & AI team. Loc Data & AI ́s mission is to support and foster the use of data from all perspectives, along with the development of policies and procedures for the monitoring and active management of data in EA Localization. And our means include building data engineering products and solutions, such as integrating data from various sources such as APIs, databases, and file systems.
This includes an understanding of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) techniques.







We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

Description:
Data Engineer and Analytics
JOB CONTEXT
Sanofi is globally deploying its new core model ERP covering Finance, SBS, Supply Chain, Trade, Manufacturing, Quality, Plant maintenance, warehouse management across all GBUs - through the implementation of a Global ERP (iSHIFT project) using SAP S4/HANA technology. All this together with other Core Solutions like QMS, LIMS and MES require strong data foundations to boost the integration between those solutions and provide a data platform to sustain the built of Digital Products.
JOB OVERVIEW
Within the Digital Analytics CoE team, Junior Data/Software Engineer will design and build solutions across different project to provide data for analytics / BI needs of different IA and Finance Ops products.
JOB SUMMARY
You will be part of a multidisciplinary team that works on the end-to-end needs of the analytics chain for Industrial Affairs & Finance Ops of the Sanofi group. You will deploy a data engineering pipeline and integration solutions with technically robust lifecycle management (e.g. new releases, change management, monitoring and troubleshooting) to provide this team with reliable datasets / KPIs.

Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Description:
We are EA
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform.
We are hiring a Data Engineering Intern for our Localization Data & AI team. Loc Data & AI ́s mission is to support and foster the use of data from all perspectives, along with the development of policies and procedures for the monitoring and active management of data in EA Localization. And our means include building data engineering products and solutions, such as integrating data from various sources such as APIs, databases, and file systems.
This includes an understanding of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) techniques.







We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

Description:
Data Engineer en Asturias.
Perfil buscado (Hombre/Mujer)

The Data Engineer will join the fast-growing analytics team and will have a high impact on a strategic digital transformation initiative with opportunities for career advancement as the team grows.

Analytics team uses the Azure Data Lake and Microsoft Power BI to provide analytics solutions and business data insights to a wide range of functions including sales supply chain operations and finance. As a specialist in our team you will be responsible for expanding this service and ensuring its continuing reliability and performance by leading initiatives to connect new data sources enhance existing data sources and manage intersections with external teams and processes.

Position activities include
Interface with enterprise architects to facilitate architecture security reviews for analytics applications
Provide administrative support for services related to analytics platforms including
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data Lake
Databricks
SQL Server
Ensure that applications have appropriate security models designed and applied
Maintain the Lakehouse architecture in ADLS using Databricks
Work with DevOps team to deploy solutions in production environments
Lead projects that include other team members and participate in projects led by other team members
Collaborate with team members across the world to share key learnings leverage ideas and solutions and to propagate best practices
Apply change management tools including training communication and documentation to manage upgrades changes and data migrations
Analyze and resolve issues and work with service providers to minimize the risk of recurrence

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment Data Engineer (Azure Databricks-Azure Data factory)

The Data Engineer to be qualified for this role must possess the following
Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area
4-7 years of relevant IT experience (Data Analytics Data Engineering)
Strong communication skills in English language (both written and spoken)
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them
Ability to coordinate with various teams across different functions
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as guide other team members
Ability to be an effective team member with remote colleagues spread across the world

Our office in Alicante is providing attractive working conditions for our employees and we are ready for the many new colleagues that we will be hiring in the coming months.

Description:
We are EA
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform.
We are hiring a Data Engineering Intern for our Localization Data & AI team. Loc Data & AI ́s mission is to support and foster the use of data from all perspectives, along with the development of policies and procedures for the monitoring and active management of data in EA Localization. And our means include building data engineering products and solutions, such as integrating data from various sources such as APIs, databases, and file systems.
This includes an understanding of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) techniques.







We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Description:
Data Engineer en Asturias.

The Data Engineer will join the fast-growing analytics team and will have a high impact on a strategic digital transformation initiative with opportunities for career advancement as the team grows.

Analytics team uses the Azure Data Lake and Microsoft Power BI to provide analytics solutions and business data insights to a wide range of functions including sales supply chain operations and finance. As a specialist in our team you will be responsible for expanding this service and ensuring its continuing reliability and performance by leading initiatives to connect new data sources enhance existing data sources and manage intersections with external teams and processes.

Interface with enterprise architects to facilitate architecture security reviews for analytics applications

Azure Data Factory

Databricks
SQL Server

Work with DevOps team to deploy solutions in production environments
Lead projects that include other team members and participate in projects led by other team members
Collaborate with team members across the world to share key learnings leverage ideas and solutions and to propagate best practices
Apply change management tools including training communication and documentation to manage upgrades changes and data migrations
Analyze and resolve issues and work with service providers to minimize the risk of recurrence

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment Data Engineer (Azure Databricks-Azure Data factory)

Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area

Strong communication skills in English language (both written and spoken)
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them
Ability to coordinate with various teams across different functions
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as guide other team members
Ability to be an effective team member with remote colleagues spread across the world
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience with Azure platform (incl. ADF and ADLS)
Extensive experience in data concepts and tools
Preference will be given to candidates with these skills

Pandas and PySpark

Description:
We are EA
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform.
We are hiring a Data Engineering Intern for our Localization Data & AI team. Loc Data & AI ́s mission is to support and foster the use of data from all perspectives, along with the development of policies and procedures for the monitoring and active management of data in EA Localization. And our means include building data engineering products and solutions, such as integrating data from various sources such as APIs, databases, and file systems.
This includes an understanding of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) techniques.







We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Description:
Data Engineer en Asturias.

The Data Engineer will join the fast-growing analytics team and will have a high impact on a strategic digital transformation initiative with opportunities for career advancement as the team grows.

Analytics team uses the Azure Data Lake and Microsoft Power BI to provide analytics solutions and business data insights to a wide range of functions including sales supply chain operations and finance. As a specialist in our team you will be responsible for expanding this service and ensuring its continuing reliability and performance by leading initiatives to connect new data sources enhance existing data sources and manage intersections with external teams and processes.

Interface with enterprise architects to facilitate architecture security reviews for analytics applications
Provide administrative support for services related to analytics platforms including
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data Lake
Databricks
SQL Server
Ensure that applications have appropriate security models designed and applied
Maintain the Lakehouse architecture in ADLS using Databricks
Work with DevOps team to deploy solutions in production environments
Lead projects that include other team members and participate in projects led by other team members
Collaborate with team members across the world to share key learnings leverage ideas and solutions and to propagate best practices
Apply change management tools including training communication and documentation to manage upgrades changes and data migrations
Analyze and resolve issues and work with service providers to minimize the risk of recurrence

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment Data Engineer (Azure Databricks-Azure Data factory)

Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area
4-7 years of relevant IT experience (Data Analytics Data Engineering)
Strong communication skills in English language (both written and spoken)
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them
Ability to coordinate with various teams across different functions
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as guide other team members
Ability to be an effective team member with remote colleagues spread across the world
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience with Azure platform (incl. ADF and ADLS)
Extensive experience in data concepts and tools
Preference will be given to candidates with these skills
Delta lake and Lakehouse architecture
Pandas and PySpark
Exposure to DevOps workflows
SQL

Description:
We are EA
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform.
We are hiring a Data Engineering Intern for our Localization Data & AI team. Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Description:
Data Engineer en Asturias.
Perfil buscado (Hombre/Mujer)

The Data Engineer will join the fast-growing analytics team and will have a high impact on a strategic digital transformation initiative with opportunities for career advancement as the team grows.

Analytics team uses the Azure Data Lake and Microsoft Power BI to provide analytics solutions and business data insights to a wide range of functions including sales supply chain operations and finance. As a specialist in our team you will be responsible for expanding this service and ensuring its continuing reliability and performance by leading initiatives to connect new data sources enhance existing data sources and manage intersections with external teams and processes.

Position activities include
Interface with enterprise architects to facilitate architecture security reviews for analytics applications
Provide administrative support for services related to analytics platforms including
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data Lake
Databricks
SQL Server
Ensure that applications have appropriate security models designed and applied
Maintain the Lakehouse architecture in ADLS using Databricks
Work with DevOps team to deploy solutions in production environments
Lead projects that include other team members and participate in projects led by other team members
Collaborate with team members across the world to share key learnings leverage ideas and solutions and to propagate best practices
Apply change management tools including training communication and documentation to manage upgrades changes and data migrations
Analyze and resolve issues and work with service providers to minimize the risk of recurrence

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment Data Engineer (Azure Databricks-Azure Data factory)

The Data Engineer to be qualified for this role must possess the following
Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area
4-7 years of relevant IT experience (Data Analytics Data Engineering)
Strong communication skills in English language (both written and spoken)
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them
Ability to coordinate with various teams across different functions
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as guide other team members
Ability to be an effective team member with remote colleagues spread across the world
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience with Azure platform (incl. ADF and ADLS)
Extensive experience in data concepts and tools
Preference will be given to candidates with these skills
Delta lake and Lakehouse architecture
Pandas and PySpark
Exposure to DevOps workflows
SQL

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment

Interesting professional opportunity based in Asturias.

Hybrid model

Azure Data,Databricks,SQL Server

Description:
Research Engineer (m/f/x/d)
Do you like Natural Language Processing (NLP)? Do you enjoy solving scientific problems? Are you passionate about creating and deploying deep learning models using cutting edge technology?
We are currently looking for a Research Engineer (m/f/x/d) for our Research team in Valencia (Spain). In this position, you will play a key role in the team and will have the opportunity to participate in innovative projects in different NLP areas: opinion mining, low-resource NLP, generative information extraction, author profiling, relation extraction, etc.
Your work will attempt to improve the company's products and be aligned to customers’ needs. However, at Symanto we will also encourage you to explore new research ideas and to publish in blogs, forums, reputable research conferences and journals.?

The vacancy
Working closely with the engineering team leader, this person will be responsible among other tasks for providing daily technical assistance to our customers, solutions to various technical matters and support during maintenance activities planning and execution phases.
Customer Support Engineering team supports the operation and maintenance of OEM Gas Turbines, Steam Turbines, Generators, Control Systems, and Auxiliary Systems. The team is dedicated for engineering support during scheduled/forced outage, during operation as well as for new business development or existing business expansion while working closely with programme management, commercial and tendering team. The team is also engaged with customers to ensure reliability, availability and safety of the operating assets.

Description:
Data Engineer en Asturias.
Perfil buscado (Hombre/Mujer)

The Data Engineer will join the fast-growing analytics team and will have a high impact on a strategic digital transformation initiative with opportunities for career advancement as the team grows.

Analytics team uses the Azure Data Lake and Microsoft Power BI to provide analytics solutions and business data insights to a wide range of functions including sales supply chain operations and finance. As a specialist in our team you will be responsible for expanding this service and ensuring its continuing reliability and performance by leading initiatives to connect new data sources enhance existing data sources and manage intersections with external teams and processes.

Interface with enterprise architects to facilitate architecture security reviews for analytics applications
Provide administrative support for services related to analytics platforms including
Azure Data Factory
Azure Data Lake
Databricks
SQL Server
Ensure that applications have appropriate security models designed and applied
Maintain the Lakehouse architecture in ADLS using Databricks
Work with DevOps team to deploy solutions in production environments
Lead projects that include other team members and participate in projects led by other team members
Collaborate with team members across the world to share key learnings leverage ideas and solutions and to propagate best practices
Apply change management tools including training communication and documentation to manage upgrades changes and data migrations
Analyze and resolve issues and work with service providers to minimize the risk of recurrence

Multinational Company belongs to the Science and Innovation environment Data Engineer (Azure Databricks-Azure Data factory)

The Data Engineer to be qualified for this role must possess the following
Bachelors Degree in math science engineering IT or related area
4-7 years of relevant IT experience (Data Analytics Data Engineering)
Strong communication skills in English language (both written and spoken)
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them
Ability to coordinate with various teams across different functions
Ability to work independently with minimal guidance as well as guide other team members
Ability to be an effective team member with remote colleagues spread across the world
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Experience with Azure platform (incl. ADF and ADLS)
Extensive experience in data concepts and tools
Preference will be given to candidates with these skills
Delta lake and Lakehouse architecture
Pandas and PySpark
Exposure to DevOps workflows
SQL

Description:
We are EA
EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform.
We are hiring a Data Engineering Intern for our Localization Data & AI team. Loc Data & AI ́s mission is to support and foster the use of data from all perspectives, along with the development of policies and procedures for the monitoring and active management of data in EA Localization. And our means include building data engineering products and solutions, such as integrating data from various sources such as APIs, databases, and file systems.
This includes an understanding of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) techniques.







We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

Description:
Job Description:
About the Role
Our engineering teams' guiding principle and its philosophy have always been to get things right through practicing disciplined engineering, not cutting corners, and of course having fun while we are at it. We believe in ensuring ownership at all levels of the organization and empowering teams. If this culture is for you, you will learn a lot while enjoying everyday and staying abreast with industry technologies and practices working with a large engineering team.
The Professional Information Business Engineering Team is looking for a Lead Software Engineer based in Barcelona, who will manage the development, integration, support and maintenance of content processing and editorial applications and ensure that they follow established SDLC policies, procedures and guidelines. We are looking for creative and passionate engineers who want to be hands-on, implement and own code all the way through deployment and in production.

Description:
Do you want to help create the future of healthcare? Siemens Healthineers is a place for people who dedicate their energy and passion to this greater cause. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry.
We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment where you have the space to stretch beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting?
Then come in and join our team as Process mining data engineer¡ (Modelo híbrido teletrabajo - Posibilidad 80% remoto)
As a process mining data engineer, you are part of the center of excellence for business intelligence front-end tools at Siemens Healthineers IT. The CoE’s prime goal is to support the organization globally in all areas of Power BI, Qlik Sense, Celonis, Valsight and other tools by providing training, guidance, consulting, development, and application management to drive self-service analytics and digitalization.

Job_title: Machine Learning Engineer / IA, 100% En remoto
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer / IA en 100% En remoto.
En Arelance sabemos que las personas son el activo más importante dentro de una empresa y por tanto invertimos muchos esfuerzos en buscar los mejores profesionales para nuestros clientes y en ofrecer a nuestros candidatos los mejores proyectos.

En este momento buscamos profesionales con al menos dos años de experiencia en proyectos de IA/ Machine Learning.

¿Qué buscamos en ti?
Experiencia en proyectos de IA/Machine Learning.
Conocimiento de los algoritmos de ML (algoritmos supervisados y no supervisados deep learning etc.)
¿Qué ofrecemos?
Si tienes interés en una gran oportunidad como ésta ¡inscríbete! ¡Queremos conocerte!

Machine learning, Data Science , IA, Python, SAS

Data DevOps

Fluidra, a multinational group listed on the Spanish Stock Exchange, is the global leader in the pool and wellness industry. Founded in 1969, Fluidra has long-standing experience in developing innovative products and services in the global residential and commercial pool market.
Fluidra has a clear mission: to create the perfect pool and wellness experience responsibly.
We are looking for a Data DevOps to join our Data Team in Sant Cugat del Valles.
The Data DevOps is a brand new role in our Data team which is pivotal to supporting the execution of our data transformation strategy at Fluidra. This role will provide you with the opportunity to embed best practice into the DevOps world whilst guiding a team on modern DevOps and Agile frameworks to help us revolutionise the way we deliver new technology.

Job_title: AIRWORTHINESS TECHNICAL ENGINEER FOR OPERATIONAL SUITABILITY DATA (OSD)
Description:
Job Description:
Mission:
The main mission of the Airworthiness Technical Engineer for Operational Certification is to generate MMEL/MOSEL projects, ETOPS/METOPS/EDTO projects, Special Military Operations and Airplane Flight Manual Weight & Balance Manual, including the definition of applicable certification requirements and the demonstration of its compliance.

Functions and Tasks:
Contribute to production of manuals related to air system Operational Certification (OSD including MMEL/MOSEL projects, ETOPS/METOPS/EDTO projects, Special Military Operations); including the definition of the applicable certification requirements and its demonstration of compliance, for the different Airbus Defence & Space Products (C295, A330 MRTT, Eurodrone, etc…).



Airbus Defence and Space SAU

Professional / Expérimenté(e) / Professionell / Profesional

Description:
We at PIA Media & PIA Digital Services are the agency for companies that think digitally about their marketing right from the start.
With more than 550 colleagues, we develop a consistent and cross-media customer experience for a wide range of customer groups of leading B2C and B2B companies - this end-to-end media approach is based on our broad knowledge and experience in content, technology, data and AI. PIA Media accompanies clients from the right media strategy to ad tech implementation, data analysis and management to the implementation of personalized campaigns on all platforms.
In addition to our offices in Hamburg, Munich, Düsseldorf and Berlin, we have two design and development hubs in Belgrade and Bucharest.
We are part of the PIA Group with over 1200 employees and 9 companies.

Job Description:
Senior Backend Software Engineer (Java)
We are looking for inventive and passionate Senior Software Engineers who want to be part of a growing technology team. You will have opportunities to present new ideas and shape the future of our company in building game-changing software. Our engineers play an important role in all stages of the product life-cycle, so we look for people who crave ownership, enjoy solving hard problems and want to improve software quality.
We are looking for people who can enhance a text Search service that manages nearly 1.5 billion text documents. This is one of our core services, which powers nearly every product we offer.
